Package com.lightbend.streams

Interface ReactiveStreamsEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AkkaEngine

    public interface ReactiveStreamsEngine
    An engine for turning reactive streams graphs into Flow publishers/subscribers.

    The zero argument ReactiveStreamsBuilder.build() method will use the ServiceLoader to load an engine for the current context classloader. It does not cache engines between invocations. If instantiating an engine is expensive (eg, it creates threads), then it is recommended that the implementation does its own caching by providing the engine using a static provider method.

    • Method Detail

      • buildPublisher

        <T> java.util.concurrent.Flow.Publisher<T> buildPublisher​(java.lang.Iterable<Stage> stages)
                                                   throws UnsupportedStageException
        Build a Flow.Publisher from the given stages.

        The following invariant will always hold true for the stages - every stage will have an outlet, while the first stage will have no inlet, but every subsequent stage will have an inlet.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of elements that the publisher publishes.
        Parameters:
        stages - The stages to build the publisher from. Will not be empty.
        Returns:
        A publisher that implements the passed in graph of stages.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedStageException - If a stage in the stages is not supported by this Reactive Streams engine.

      • buildSubscriber

        <T,R> SubscriberWithResult<T,R> buildSubscriber​(java.lang.Iterable<Stage> stages)
                                         throws UnsupportedStageException
        Build a Flow.Subscriber from the given stages.

        The following invariant will always hold true for the stages - every stage will have an inlet, while the last stage will have no outlet, but every prior stage will have an outlet.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of elements that the subscriber subscribes to.
        R - The result of subscribing to the stages.
        Parameters:
        stages - The stages to build the subscriber from. Will not be empty.
        Returns:
        A subscriber that implements the passed in graph of stages.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedStageException - If a stage in the stages is not supported by this Reactive Streams engine.

      • buildProcessor

        <T,R> java.util.concurrent.Flow.Processor<T,R> buildProcessor​(java.lang.Iterable<Stage> stages)
                                                       throws UnsupportedStageException
        Build a Flow.Processor from the given stages.

        The following invariant will always hold true for the stages - every stage will have both an inlet and an outlet.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of elements that the processor subscribes to.
        R - The type of elements that the processor publishes.
        Parameters:
        stages - The stages to build the processor from. If empty, then the processor should be an identity processor.
        Returns:
        A processor that implements the passed in graph of stages.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedStageException - If a stage in the stages is not supported by this Reactive Streams engine.

      • buildCompletion

        <T> java.util.concurrent.CompletionStage<T> buildCompletion​(java.lang.Iterable<Stage> stages)
                                                     throws UnsupportedStageException
        Build a closed graph from the given stages.

        The following invariant will always hold true for the stages - the first stage will have no inlet but will have an outlet, the last stage will have an inlet but no outlet, and every other stage will have both an inlet and an outlet.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the result of running the closed graph.
        Parameters:
        stages - The stages to build the closed graph from. Will not be empty.
        Returns:
        A CompletionStage of the result of running the graph.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedStageException - If a stage in the stages is not supported by this reactive streams engine.
